   21: %% This is a development feature when developing a new file module,
   22: %% ugly but practical.
   23: -ifndef(FILE_MODULE).
   24: -define(FILE_MODULE, file).
   25: -endif.
   26: -ifndef(FILE_SUITE).
   27: -define(FILE_SUITE, file_SUITE).
   28: -endif.
   29: -ifndef(FILE_INIT).
   30: -define(FILE_INIT(Config), Config).
   31: -endif.
   32: -ifndef(FILE_FINI).
   33: -define(FILE_FINI(Config), Config).
   34: -endif.
   35: -ifndef(FILE_INIT_PER_TESTCASE).
   36: -define(FILE_INIT_PER_TESTCASE(Config), Config).
   37: -endif.
   38: -ifndef(FILE_FIN_PER_TESTCASE).
   39: -define(FILE_FIN_PER_TESTCASE(Config), Config).
   40: -endif.
   41: 
   42: -define(PRIM_FILE, prim_file).
   43: 
   44: -module(?FILE_SUITE).

  128: suite() ->
  129:     [{ct_hooks,[ts_install_cth]},

  143: groups() ->

  145: 		 list_dir, list_dir_error, untranslatable_names,
  146: 		 untranslatable_names_error]},

  148:       [{group, open}, {group, pos}, {group, file_info},
  149:        {group, consult}, {group, eval}, {group, script},
  150:        truncate, sync, datasync, advise, allocate, allocate_file_size]},
  151:      {open, [],
  152:       [open1, old_modes, new_modes, path_open, close, access,
  153:        read_write, pread_write, append, open_errors,
  154:        exclusive]},

  179: 
  180: init_per_group(_GroupName, Config) ->
  181:     Config.
  182: 
  183: end_per_group(bench, Config) ->
  184:     ScratchDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
  185:     file:delete(filename:join(ScratchDir, "benchmark_scratch_file")),
  186:     Config;
  187: end_per_group(_GroupName, Config) ->
  188:     Config.
  189: 
  190: 
  191: init_per_suite(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  192:     os:internal_init_cmd_shell(),
  193:     SaslConfig = case application:start(sasl) of
  194: 		     {error, {already_started, sasl}} ->
  195: 			 [];
  196: 		     ok ->
  197: 			 [{sasl,started}]
  198: 		 end,
  199:     application:start(os_mon),
  200: 
  201:     case os:type() of
  202: 	{win32, _} ->
  203: 	    Priv = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
  204: 	    HasAccessTime =
  205: 		case ?FILE_MODULE:read_file_info(Priv) of
  206: 		    {ok, #file_info{atime={_, {0, 0, 0}}}} ->
  207: 			%% This is a unfortunately a FAT file system.
  208: 			[no_access_time];
  209: 		    {ok, _} ->
  210: 			[]
  211: 		end,
  212: 	    ?FILE_INIT(HasAccessTime++Config++SaslConfig);
  213: 	_ ->
  214: 	    ?FILE_INIT(Config++SaslConfig)
  215:     end.
  216: 
  217: end_per_suite(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  218:     case os:type() of
  219: 	{win32, _} ->
  220: 	    os:cmd("subst z: /d");
  221: 	_ ->
  222: 	    ok
  223:     end,
  224: 
  225:     application:stop(os_mon),
  226:     case proplists:get_value(sasl, Config) of
  227: 	started ->
  228: 	    application:stop(sasl);
  229: 	_Else ->
  230: 	    ok
  231:     end,
  232:     ?FILE_FINI(Config).
  233: 
  234: init_per_testcase(_Func, Config) ->
  235:     %%error_logger:info_msg("~p:~p *****~n", [?MODULE, _Func]),
  236:     ?FILE_INIT_PER_TESTCASE(Config).
  237: 
  238: end_per_testcase(_Func, Config) ->
  239:     %% error_logger:info_msg("~p:~p END *****~n", [?MODULE, _Func]),
  240:     ?FILE_FIN_PER_TESTCASE(Config).
  241: 
  242: %% Matches a term (the last) against alternatives
  243: expect(X, _, X) ->
  244:     X;
  245: expect(_, X, X) ->
  246:     X.
  247: 
  248: expect(X, _, _, X) ->
  249:     X;
  250: expect(_, X, _, X) ->
  251:     X;
  252: expect(_, _, X, X) ->
  253:     X.
  254: 
  255: expect(X, _, _, _, X) ->
  256:     X;
  257: expect(_, X, _, _, X) ->
  258:     X;
  259: expect(_, _, X, _, X) ->
  260:     X;
  261: expect(_, _, _, X, X) ->
  262:     X.
  263: 
  264: %% Calculate the time difference
  265: time_dist({YY, MM, DD, H, M, S}, DT) ->
  266:     time_dist({{YY, MM, DD}, {H, M, S}}, DT);
  267: time_dist(DT, {YY, MM, DD, H, M, S}) ->
  268:     time_dist(DT, {{YY, MM, DD}, {H, M, S}});
  269: time_dist({_D1, _T1} = DT1, {_D2, _T2} = DT2) ->
  270:     calendar:datetime_to_gregorian_seconds(DT2)
  271: 	- calendar:datetime_to_gregorian_seconds(DT1).
  272: 
  273: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
  274: mini_server(Parent) ->
  275:     receive
  276: 	die ->
  277: 	    ok;
  278: 	{io_request,From,To,{put_chars,_Encoding,Data}} ->
  279: 	    Parent ! {io_request,From,To,{put_chars,Data}},
  280: 	    From ! {io_reply, To, ok},
  281: 	    mini_server(Parent);
  282: 	{io_request,From,To,{get_chars,_Encoding,'',N}} ->
  283: 	    Parent ! {io_request,From,To,{get_chars,'',N}},
  284: 	    From ! {io_reply, To, {ok, lists:duplicate(N,$a)}},
  285: 	    mini_server(Parent);
  286: 	{io_request,From,To,{get_line,_Encoding,''}} ->
  287: 	    Parent ! {io_request,From,To,{get_line,''}},
  288: 	    From ! {io_reply, To, {ok, "hej\n"}},
  289: 	    mini_server(Parent)
  290:     end.
  291: 
  292: %% Test that standard i/o-servers work with file module.
  293: standard_io(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  294:     %% Really just a smoke test
  295:     Pid = spawn(?MODULE,mini_server,[self()]),
  296:     register(mini_server,Pid),
  297:     ok = file:write(mini_server,<<"hej\n">>),
  298:     receive
  299: 	{io_request,_,_,{put_chars,<<"hej\n">>}} ->
  300: 	    ok
  301:     after 1000 ->
  302: 	    exit(noreply)
  303:     end,
  304:     {ok,"aaaaa"} = file:read(mini_server,5),
  305:     receive
  306: 	{io_request,_,_,{get_chars,'',5}} ->
  307: 	    ok
  308:     after 1000 ->
  309: 	    exit(noreply)
  310:     end,
  311:     {ok,"hej\n"} = file:read_line(mini_server),
  312:     receive
  313: 	{io_request,_,_,{get_line,''}} ->
  314: 	    ok
  315:     after 1000 ->
  316: 	    exit(noreply)
  317:     end,
  318:     OldGL = group_leader(),
  319:     group_leader(Pid,self()),
  320:     ok = file:write(standard_io,<<"hej\n">>),
  321:     group_leader(OldGL,self()),
  322:     receive
  323: 	{io_request,_,_,{put_chars,<<"hej\n">>}} ->
  324: 	    ok
  325:     after 1000 ->
  326: 	    exit(noreply)
  327:     end,
  328:     group_leader(Pid,self()),
  329:     {ok,"aaaaa"} = file:read(standard_io,5),
  330:     group_leader(OldGL,self()),
  331:     receive
  332: 	{io_request,_,_,{get_chars,'',5}} ->
  333: 	    ok
  334:     after 1000 ->
  335: 	    exit(noreply)
  336:     end,
  337:     group_leader(Pid,self()),
  338:     {ok,"hej\n"} = file:read_line(standard_io),
  339:     group_leader(OldGL,self()),
  340:     receive
  341: 	{io_request,_,_,{get_line,''}} ->
  342: 	    ok
  343:     after 1000 ->
  344: 	    exit(noreply)
  345:     end,
  346:     Pid ! die,
  347:     receive after 1000 -> ok end.
  348: 
  349: %% Test that the old file IO protocol =< R16B still works.
  350: old_io_protocol(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  351:     RootDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir,Config),
  352:     Name = filename:join(RootDir,
  353: 			 atom_to_list(?MODULE)
  354: 			 ++"old_io_protocol.fil"),
  355:     MyData = "0123456789abcdefghijklmnopqrstuvxyz",
  356:     ok = ?FILE_MODULE:write_file(Name, MyData),
  357:     {ok, Fd} = ?FILE_MODULE:open(Name, write),
  358:     Fd ! {file_request,self(),Fd,truncate},
  359:     receive
  360: 	{file_reply,Fd,ok} -> ok
  361:     end,
  362:     ok = ?FILE_MODULE:close(Fd),
  363:     {ok, <<>>} = ?FILE_MODULE:read_file(Name),
  364:     [] = flush(),
  365:     ok.
  366: 
  367: unicode_mode(Config) ->
  368:     Dir = {dir, proplists:get_value(priv_dir,Config)},
  369:     OptVariants = [[Dir],
  370: 		   [Dir, {encoding, utf8}],
  371: 		   [Dir, binary],
  372: 		   [Dir, binary, {encoding, utf8}]
  373: 		  ],
  374:     ReadVariants = [{read, fun(Fd) -> um_read(Fd, fun(Fd1) -> file:read(Fd1, 1024) end) end},
  375: 		    {read_line, fun(Fd) -> um_read(Fd, fun(Fd1) -> file:read_line(Fd1) end) end}
  376: 		    %%{pread, fun(Fd) -> file:pread(Fd, 0, 1024) end},
  377: 		    %%{preadl, fun(Fd) -> file:pread(Fd, [{0, 1024}]) end},
  378: 		   ],
  379: 
  380:     _ = [read_write_0("ASCII: list:  Hello World", Read, Opt) ||
  381: 	    Opt <- OptVariants, Read <- ReadVariants],
  382:     _ = [read_write_0("LATIN1: list: åäöÅÄÖ", Read, Opt) ||
  383: 	    Opt <- OptVariants, Read <- ReadVariants],
  384:     _ = [read_write_0(<<"ASCII: bin: Hello World">>, Read, Opt) ||
  385: 	    Opt <- OptVariants, Read <- ReadVariants],
  386:     _ = [read_write_0(<<"LATIN1: bin: åäöÅÄÖ">>, Read, Opt) ||
  387: 	    Opt <- OptVariants, Read <- ReadVariants],
  388:     %% These will be double encoded if option is encoding utf-8
  389:     _ = [read_write_0(<<"UTF8: bin: Ωß"/utf8>>, Read, Opt) ||
  390: 	    Opt <- OptVariants, Read <- ReadVariants],
  391:     %% These should not work (with encoding set to utf-8)
  392:     %%   according to file's documentation
  393:     _ = [read_write_0("UTF8: list: Ωß", Read, Opt) ||
  394: 	    Opt <- OptVariants, Read <- ReadVariants],
  395:     ok.
  396: 
  397: read_write_0(Str, {Func, ReadFun}, Options) ->
  398:     try
  399: 	Res = read_write_1(Str, ReadFun, Options),
  400: 	io:format("~p: ~ts ~p '~p'~n", [Func, Str, tl(Options), Res]),
  401: 	ok
  402:     catch {fail, Line, ReadBytes = [_|_]} ->
  403: 	    io:format("~p:~p: ~p ERROR: ~w vs~n             ~w~n  - ~p~n",
  404: 		      [?MODULE, Line, Func, Str, ReadBytes, Options]),
  405: 	    exit({error, ?LINE});
  406: 	  {fail, Line, ReadBytes} ->
  407: 	    io:format("~p:~p: ~p ERROR: ~ts vs~n             ~w~n  - ~p~n",
  408: 		      [?MODULE, Line, Func, Str, ReadBytes, Options]),
  409: 	    exit({error, ?LINE});
  410: 	  error:What:Stacktrace ->
  411: 	    io:format("~p:??: ~p ERROR: ~p from~n  ~w~n  ~p~n",
  412: 		      [?MODULE, Func, What, Str, Options]),
  413: 
  414: 	    io:format("\t~p~n", [Stacktrace]),
  415: 	    exit({error, ?LINE})
  416:     end.
  417: 
  418: read_write_1(Str0, ReadFun, [{dir,Dir}|Options]) ->
  419:     File = um_filename(Str0, Dir, Options),
  420:     Pre = "line 1\n", Post = "\nlast line\n",
  421:     Str = case is_list(Str0) andalso lists:max(Str0) > 255 of
  422: 	      false ->  %% Normal case Use options
  423: 		  {ok, FdW} = file:open(File, [write|Options]),
  424: 		  IO = [Pre, Str0, Post],
  425: 		  ok = file:write(FdW, IO),
  426: 		  case is_binary(Str0) of
  427: 		      true -> iolist_to_binary(IO);
  428: 		      false -> lists:append(IO)
  429: 		  end;
  430: 	      true -> %% Test unicode lists
  431: 		  {ok, FdW} = file:open(File, [write]),
  432: 		  Utf8 = unicode:characters_to_binary([Pre, Str0, Post]),
  433: 		  file:write(FdW, Utf8),
  434: 		  {unicode, Utf8}
  435: 	  end,
  436:     file:close(FdW),
  437:     {ok, FdR} = file:open(File, [read|Options]),
  438:     ReadRes = ReadFun(FdR),
  439:     file:close(FdR),
  440:     Res = um_check(Str, ReadRes, Options),
  441:     file:delete(File),
  442:     Res.
  443: 
  444: 
  445: um_read(Fd, Fun) ->
  446:     um_read(Fd, Fun, []).
  447: 
  448: um_read(Fd, Fun, Acc) ->
  449:     case Fun(Fd) of
  450: 	eof ->
  451: 	    case is_binary(hd(Acc)) of
  452: 		true  -> {ok, iolist_to_binary(lists:reverse(Acc))};
  453: 		false -> {ok, lists:append(lists:reverse(Acc))}
  454: 	    end;
  455: 	{ok, Data} ->
  456: 	    um_read(Fd, Fun, [Data|Acc]);
  457: 	Error ->
  458: 	    Error
  459:     end.
  460: 
  461: 
  462: um_check(Str, {ok, Str}, _) -> ok;
  463: um_check(Bin, {ok, Res}, _Options) when is_binary(Bin), is_list(Res) ->
  464:     case list_to_binary(Res) of
  465: 	Bin -> ok;
  466: 	_ -> ?THROW_ERROR(Res)
  467:     end;
  468: um_check(Str, {ok, Res}, _Options) when is_list(Str), is_binary(Res) ->
  469:     case iolist_to_binary(Str) of
  470: 	Res -> ok;
  471: 	_ -> ?THROW_ERROR(Res)
  472:     end;
  473: um_check({unicode, Utf8Bin}, Res, Options) ->
  474:     um_check_unicode(Utf8Bin, Res,
  475: 		     proplists:get_value(binary, Options, false),
  476: 		     proplists:get_value(encoding, Options, none));
  477: um_check(_Str, Res, _Options) ->
  478:     ?THROW_ERROR(Res).
  479: 
  480: um_check_unicode(Utf8Bin, {ok, Utf8Bin}, true, none) ->
  481:     ok;
  482: um_check_unicode(Utf8Bin, {ok, List = [_|_]}, false, none) ->
  483:     case binary_to_list(Utf8Bin) == List of
  484: 	true -> ok;
  485: 	false -> ?THROW_ERROR(List)
  486:     end;
  487: um_check_unicode(_Utf8Bin, {error, {no_translation, unicode, latin1}}, _, _) ->
  488:     no_translation;
  489: um_check_unicode(_Utf8Bin, Error = {error, _}, _, _Unicode) ->
  490:     ?THROW_ERROR(Error);
  491: um_check_unicode(_Utf8Bin, {ok, _ListOrBin}, _, _UTF8_) ->
  492:     %% List = if is_binary(ListOrBin) -> unicode:characters_to_list(ListOrBin);
  493:     %% 	      true -> ListOrBin
  494:     %% 	   end,
  495:     %% io:format("In: ~w~n", [binary_to_list(Utf8Bin)]),
  496:     %% io:format("Ut: ~w~n", [List]),
  497:     ?THROW_ERROR({shoud_be, no_translation}).
  498: 
  499: um_filename(Bin, Dir, Options) when is_binary(Bin) ->
  500:     um_filename(binary_to_list(Bin), Dir, Options);
  501: um_filename(Str = [_|_], Dir, Options) ->
  502:     Name = hd(string:lexemes(Str, ":")),
  503:     Enc = atom_to_list(proplists:get_value(encoding, Options, latin1)),
  504:     File = case lists:member(binary, Options) of
  505: 	       true ->
  506: 		   "test_" ++ Name ++ "_bin_enc_" ++ Enc;
  507: 	       false ->
  508: 		   "test_" ++ Name ++ "_list_enc_" ++ Enc
  509: 	   end,
  510:     filename:join(Dir, File).
  511: 
  512: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
  513: 
  514: read_write_file(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  515:     RootDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir,Config),
  516:     Name = filename:join(RootDir,
  517: 			 atom_to_list(?MODULE)
  518: 			 ++"_read_write_file"),
  519: 
  520:     %% Try writing and reading back some term
  521:     SomeTerm = {"This term",{will,be},[written,$t,$o],1,file,[]},
  522:     Bin1 = term_to_binary(SomeTerm),
  523:     ok = do_read_write_file(Name, Bin1),
  524: 
  525:     %% Try a "null" term
  526:     NullTerm = [],
  527:     Bin2 = term_to_binary(NullTerm),
  528:     ok = do_read_write_file(Name, Bin2),
  529: 
  530:     %% Try reading a nonexistent file
  531:     Name2 = filename:join(RootDir,
  532: 			  atom_to_list(?MODULE)
  533: 			  ++"_nonexistent_file"),
  534:     {error, enoent} = ?FILE_MODULE:read_file(Name2),
  535:     {error, enoent} = ?FILE_MODULE:read_file(""),
  536:     {error, enoent} = ?FILE_MODULE:read_file(''),
  537:     {error, enoent} = ?FILE_MODULE:read_file(Name2, [raw]),
  538:     {error, enoent} = ?FILE_MODULE:read_file("", [raw]),
  539:     {error, enoent} = ?FILE_MODULE:read_file('', [raw]),
  540: 
  541:     %% Try writing to a bad filename
  542:     {error, enoent} = do_read_write_file("", Bin2),
  543: 
  544:     %% Try writing something else than a binary
  545:     {error, badarg} = do_read_write_file(Name, {1,2,3}),
  546:     {error, badarg} = do_read_write_file(Name, self()),
  547: 
  548:     %% Some non-term binaries
  549:     ok = do_read_write_file(Name, []),
  550: 
  551:     %% Write some iolists
  552:     ok = do_read_write_file(Name, [Bin1,[],[[Bin2]]]),
  553:     ok = do_read_write_file(Name, ["string",<<"binary">>]),
  554:     ok = do_read_write_file(Name, "pure string"),
  555: 
  556:     [] = flush(),
  557:     ok.
  558: 
  559: do_read_write_file(Name, Data) ->
  560:     case ?FILE_MODULE:write_file(Name, Data) of
  561: 	ok ->
  562: 	    BinData = iolist_to_binary(Data),
  563: 	    {ok,BinData} = ?FILE_MODULE:read_file(Name),
  564: 	    {ok,BinData} = ?FILE_MODULE:read_file(Name, [raw]),
  565: 
  566: 	    ok = ?FILE_MODULE:write_file(Name, Data, []),
  567: 	    {ok,BinData} = ?FILE_MODULE:read_file(Name),
  568: 	    {ok,BinData} = ?FILE_MODULE:read_file(Name, [raw]),
  569: 
  570: 	    ok = ?FILE_MODULE:write_file(Name, Data, [raw]),
  571: 	    {ok,BinData} = ?FILE_MODULE:read_file(Name),
  572: 	    {ok,BinData} = ?FILE_MODULE:read_file(Name, [raw]),
  573: 
  574: 	    ok;
  575: 	{error,_}=Res ->
  576: 	    Res = ?FILE_MODULE:write_file(Name, Data, []),
  577: 	    Res = ?FILE_MODULE:write_file(Name, Data, [raw]),
  578: 	    Res
  579:     end.
  580: 
  581: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
  582: 
  583: 
  584: make_del_dir(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  585:     RootDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir,Config),
  586:     NewDir = filename:join(RootDir,
  587: 			   atom_to_list(?MODULE)
  588: 			   ++"_mk-dir"),
  589:     ok = ?FILE_MODULE:make_dir(NewDir),
  590:     {error, eexist} = ?FILE_MODULE:make_dir(NewDir),
  591:     ok = ?FILE_MODULE:del_dir(NewDir),
  592:     {error, enoent} = ?FILE_MODULE:del_dir(NewDir),
  593:     %% Make sure we are not in a directory directly under test_server
  594:     %% as that would result in eacces errors when trying to delete '..',
  595:     %% because there are processes having that directory as current.
  596:     ok = ?FILE_MODULE:make_dir(NewDir),
  597:     {ok,CurrentDir} = file:get_cwd(),
  598:     case {os:type(), length(NewDir) >= 260 } of
  599: 	{{win32,_}, true} ->
  600: 	    io:format("Skip set_cwd for windows path longer than 260 (MAX_PATH)\n", []),
  601: 	    io:format("\nNewDir = ~p\n", [NewDir]);
  602:     	_ ->
  603: 	    ok = ?FILE_MODULE:set_cwd(NewDir)
  604:     end,
  605:     try
  606: 	%% Check that we get an error when trying to create...
  607: 	%% a deep directory
  608: 	NewDir2 = filename:join(RootDir,
  609: 				atom_to_list(?MODULE)
  610: 				++"_mk-dir-noexist/foo"),
  611: 	{error, enoent} = ?FILE_MODULE:make_dir(NewDir2),
  612: 	%% a nameless directory
  613: 	{error, enoent} = ?FILE_MODULE:make_dir(""),
  614: 	%% a directory with illegal name
  615: 	{error, badarg} = ?FILE_MODULE:make_dir({1,2,3}),
  616: 
  617: 	%% a directory with illegal name, even if it's a (bad) list
  618: 	{error, badarg} = ?FILE_MODULE:make_dir([1,2,3,{}]),
  619: 
  620: 	%% Maybe this isn't an error, exactly, but worth mentioning anyway:
  621: 	%% ok = ?FILE_MODULE:make_dir([$f,$o,$o,0,$b,$a,$r])),
  622: 	%% The above line works, and created a directory "./foo"
  623: 	%% More elegant would maybe have been to fail, or to really create
  624: 	%% a directory, but with a name that incorporates the "bar" part of
  625: 	%% the list, so that [$f,$o,$o,0,$f,$o,$o] wouldn't refer to the same
  626: 	%% dir. But this would slow it down.
  627: 
  628: 	%% Try deleting some bad directories
  629: 	%% Deleting the parent directory to the current, sounds dangerous, huh?
  630: 	%% Don't worry ;-) the parent directory should never be empty, right?
  631: 	case ?FILE_MODULE:del_dir('..') of
  632: 	    {error, eexist} -> ok;
  633: 	    {error, eacces} -> ok;		%OpenBSD
  634: 	    {error, einval} -> ok			%FreeBSD
  635: 	end,
  636: 	{error, enoent} = ?FILE_MODULE:del_dir(""),
  637: 	{error, badarg} = ?FILE_MODULE:del_dir([3,2,1,{}]),
  638: 
  639: 	[] = flush()
  640:     after
  641: 	?FILE_MODULE:set_cwd(CurrentDir)
  642:     end,
  643:     ok.
  644: 
  645: make_del_dir_r(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  646:     RootDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
  647:     NewDir = filename:join(RootDir, ?MODULE_STRING ++ "_make_del_dir_r"),
  648:     ok = ?FILE_MODULE:make_dir(NewDir),
  649: 
  650:     %% Create:
  651:     %% newdir/
  652:     %%     file1
  653:     %%     dir/
  654:     %%         file2
  655:     %%         link -> /newdir/file1
  656:     File1 = test_server:temp_name(filename:join(NewDir, "file1")),
  657:     ok = ?FILE_MODULE:write_file(File1, <<"file1">>),
  658:     Dir = test_server:temp_name(filename:join(NewDir, "dir")),
  659:     ok = ?FILE_MODULE:make_dir(Dir),
  660:     File2 = test_server:temp_name(filename:join(Dir, "file2")),
  661:     ok = ?FILE_MODULE:write_file(File2, <<"file2">>),
  662:     Link = test_server:temp_name(filename:join(Dir, "link")),
  663:     case ?FILE_MODULE:make_symlink(File1, Link) of
  664:         {error, enotsup} -> ok; % symlinks not supported
  665:         {error, eperm} -> {win32, _} = os:type(), ok; % not allowed to make symlinks
  666:         ok -> ok
  667:     end,
  668: 
  669:     %% check that del_dir_r/1 succeeds on non-empty dir
  670:     ok = ?FILE_MODULE:del_dir_r(Dir),
  671:     {error, enoent} = ?FILE_MODULE:read_file_info(Dir),
  672:     %% check that the symlink wasn't followed
  673:     {ok, _} = ?FILE_MODULE:read_file_info(File1),
  674: 
  675:     %% clean up
  676:     ?FILE_MODULE:del_dir_r(NewDir),
  677:     [] = flush(),
  678:     ok.
  679: 
  680: cur_dir_0(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  681:     %% Find out the current dir, and cd to it ;-)
  682:     {ok,BaseDir} = ?FILE_MODULE:get_cwd(),
  683:     Dir1 = BaseDir ++ "", %% Check that it's a string
  684:     ok = ?FILE_MODULE:set_cwd(Dir1),
  685: 
  686:     %% Make a new dir, and cd to that
  687:     RootDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir,Config),
  688:     NewDir = filename:join(RootDir,
  689: 			   atom_to_list(?MODULE)
  690: 			   ++"_curdir"),
  691:     ok = ?FILE_MODULE:make_dir(NewDir),
  692:     case {os:type(), length(NewDir) >= 260} of
  693: 	{{win32,_}, true} ->
  694: 	    io:format("Skip set_cwd for windows path longer than 260 (MAX_PATH):\n"),
  695: 	    io:format("\nNewDir = ~p\n", [NewDir]);
  696: 	_ ->
  697: 	    io:format("cd to ~s",[NewDir]),
  698:     	    ok = ?FILE_MODULE:set_cwd(NewDir),
  699: 
  700: 	    %% Create a file in the new current directory, and check that it
  701: 	    %% really is created there
  702: 	    UncommonName = "uncommon.fil",
  703: 	    {ok,Fd} = ?FILE_MODULE:open(UncommonName,read_write),
  704: 	    ok = ?FILE_MODULE:close(Fd),
  705: 	    {ok,NewDirFiles} = ?FILE_MODULE:list_dir("."),
  706: 	    true = lists:member(UncommonName,NewDirFiles),
  707: 
  708: 	    %% Ensure that we get the same result with a trailing slash; the
  709: 	    %% APIs used on Windows will choke on them if passed directly.
  710: 	    {ok,NewDirFiles} = ?FILE_MODULE:list_dir("./"),
  711: 
  712: 	    %% Delete the directory and return to the old current directory
  713: 	    %% and check that the created file isn't there (too!)
  714: 	    expect({error, einval}, {error, eacces}, 
  715: 	    	   ?FILE_MODULE:del_dir(NewDir)),
  716: 	    ?FILE_MODULE:delete(UncommonName),
  717: 	    {ok,[]} = ?FILE_MODULE:list_dir("."),
  718: 	    ok = ?FILE_MODULE:set_cwd(Dir1),
  719: 	    io:format("cd back to ~s",[Dir1]),
  720: 
  721: 	    ok = ?FILE_MODULE:del_dir(NewDir),
  722: 	    {error, enoent} = ?FILE_MODULE:set_cwd(NewDir),
  723: 	    ok = ?FILE_MODULE:set_cwd(Dir1),
  724: 	    io:format("cd back to ~s",[Dir1]),
  725: 	    {ok,OldDirFiles} = ?FILE_MODULE:list_dir("."),
  726: 	    false = lists:member(UncommonName,OldDirFiles)
  727:     end,
  728: 
  729:     %% Try doing some bad things
  730:     {error, badarg} = ?FILE_MODULE:set_cwd({foo,bar}),
  731:     {error, enoent} = ?FILE_MODULE:set_cwd(""),
  732:     {error, enoent} = ?FILE_MODULE:set_cwd(".......a......"),
  733:     {ok,BaseDir} = ?FILE_MODULE:get_cwd(), %% Still there?
  734: 
  735:     %% On Windows, there should only be slashes, no backslashes,
  736:     %% in the return value of get_cwd().
  737:     %% (The test is harmless on Unix, because filenames usually
  738:     %% don't contain backslashes.)
  739: 
  740:     {ok, BaseDir} = ?FILE_MODULE:get_cwd(),
  741:     false = lists:member($\\, BaseDir),
  742: 
  743:     [] = flush(),
  744:     ok.
  745: 
  746: %% Tests ?FILE_MODULE:get_cwd/1.
  747: 
  748: cur_dir_1(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  749:     case os:type() of
  750: 	{win32, _} ->
  751: 	    win_cur_dir_1(Config);
  752: 	_ ->
  753: 	    {error, enotsup} = ?FILE_MODULE:get_cwd("d:")
  754:     end,
  755:     [] = flush(),
  756:     ok.
  757: 
  758: win_cur_dir_1(_Config) ->
  759:     {ok,BaseDir} = ?FILE_MODULE:get_cwd(),
  760: 
  761:     %% Get the drive letter from the current directory,
  762:     %% and try to get current directory for that drive.
  763: 
  764:     [CurDrive,$:|_] = BaseDir,
  765:     {ok,BaseDir} = ?FILE_MODULE:get_cwd([CurDrive,$:]),
  766:     io:format("BaseDir = ~s\n", [BaseDir]),
  767: 
  768:     %% We should error out on non-existent drives. Any reasonable system will
  769:     %% have at least one.
  770:     CurDirs = [?FILE_MODULE:get_cwd([Drive,$:]) || Drive <- lists:seq($A, $Z)],
  771:     lists:member({error,eaccess}, CurDirs),
  772: 
  773:     %% Unfortunately, there is no way to move away from the
  774:     %% current drive as we can't use the "subst" command from
  775:     %% a SSH connection. We can't test any more.
  776: 
  777:     ok.
  778: 
  779: 
  780: %%%
  781: %%% Test list_dir() on a non-existing pathname.
  782: %%%
  783: 
  784: list_dir_error(Config) ->
  785:     Priv = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
  786:     NonExisting = filename:join(Priv, "non-existing-dir"),
  787:     {error,enoent} = ?FILE_MODULE:list_dir(NonExisting),
  788:     ok.
  789: 
  790: %%%
  791: %%% Test list_dir() and list_dir_all().
  792: %%%
  793: 
  794: list_dir(Config) ->
  795:     RootDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
  796:     TestDir = filename:join(RootDir, ?MODULE_STRING++"_list_dir"),
  797:     ?FILE_MODULE:make_dir(TestDir),
  798:     list_dir_1(TestDir, 42, []).
  799: 
  800: list_dir_1(TestDir, 0, Sorted) ->
  801:     [ok = ?FILE_MODULE:delete(filename:join(TestDir, F)) ||
  802: 	F <- Sorted],
  803:     ok = ?FILE_MODULE:del_dir(TestDir);
  804: list_dir_1(TestDir, Cnt, Sorted0) ->
  805:     Base = "file" ++ integer_to_list(Cnt),
  806:     Name = filename:join(TestDir, Base),
  807:     ok = ?FILE_MODULE:write_file(Name, Base),
  808:     Sorted = lists:merge([Base], Sorted0),
  809:     {ok,DirList0} = ?FILE_MODULE:list_dir(TestDir),
  810:     {ok,DirList1} = ?FILE_MODULE:list_dir_all(TestDir),
  811:     Sorted = lists:sort(DirList0),
  812:     Sorted = lists:sort(DirList1),
  813:     list_dir_1(TestDir, Cnt-1, Sorted).
  814: 
  815: untranslatable_names(Config) ->
  816:     case no_untranslatable_names() of
  817: 	false ->
  818: 	    untranslatable_names_1(Config);
  819:         os ->
  820: 	    {skip,"Not a problem on this OS"};
  821:         fs ->
  822:             {skip,"Not a problem on this FS"}
  823:     end.
  824: 
  825: untranslatable_names_1(Config) ->
  826:     {ok,OldCwd} = file:get_cwd(),
  827:     PrivDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
  828:     Dir = filename:join(PrivDir, "untranslatable_names"),
  829:     ok = file:make_dir(Dir),
  830:     {ok, Peer, Node} = ?CT_PEER(["+fnu"]),
  831:     try
  832: 	ok = file:set_cwd(Dir),
  833: 	[ok = file:write_file(F, F) || {_,F} <- untranslatable_names()],
  834: 
  835: 	ExpectedListDir0 = [unicode:characters_to_list(N, utf8) ||
  836: 			       {utf8,N} <- untranslatable_names()],
  837: 	ExpectedListDir = lists:sort(ExpectedListDir0),
  838: 	io:format("ExpectedListDir: ~p\n", [ExpectedListDir]),
  839: 	ExpectedListDir = call_and_sort(Node, file, list_dir, [Dir]),
  840: 
  841: 	ExpectedListDirAll0 = [case Enc of
  842: 				   utf8 ->
  843: 				       unicode:characters_to_list(N, utf8);
  844: 				   latin1 ->
  845: 				       N
  846: 			       end || {Enc,N} <- untranslatable_names()],
  847: 	ExpectedListDirAll = lists:sort(ExpectedListDirAll0),
  848: 	io:format("ExpectedListDirAll: ~p\n", [ExpectedListDirAll]),
  849: 	ExpectedListDirAll = call_and_sort(Node, file, list_dir_all, [Dir])
  850:     after
  851: 	catch peer:stop(Peer),
  852: 	file:set_cwd(OldCwd),
  853: 	[file:delete(F) || {_,F} <- untranslatable_names()],
  854: 	file:del_dir(Dir)
  855:     end,
  856:     ok.
  857: 
  858: untranslatable_names_error(Config) ->
  859:     case no_untranslatable_names() of
  860: 	false ->
  861: 	    untranslatable_names_error_1(Config);
  862:         os ->
  863: 	    {skip,"Not a problem on this OS"};
  864:         fs ->
  865:             {skip,"Not a problem on this FS"}
  866:     end.
  867: 
  868: untranslatable_names_error_1(Config) ->
  869:     {ok,OldCwd} = file:get_cwd(),
  870:     PrivDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
  871:     Dir = filename:join(PrivDir, "untranslatable_names_error"),
  872:     ok = file:make_dir(Dir),
  873:     {ok, Peer, Node} = ?CT_PEER(["+fnue"]),
  874:     try
  875: 	ok = file:set_cwd(Dir),
  876: 	[ok = file:write_file(F, F) || {_,F} <- untranslatable_names()],
  877: 
  878: 	ExpectedListDir0 = [unicode:characters_to_list(N, utf8) ||
  879: 			       {utf8,N} <- untranslatable_names()],
  880: 	ExpectedListDir = lists:sort(ExpectedListDir0),
  881: 	io:format("ExpectedListDir: ~p\n", [ExpectedListDir]),
  882: 	{error,{no_translation,BadFile}} =
  883: 	    rpc:call(Node, file, list_dir, [Dir]),
  884: 	true = lists:keymember(BadFile, 2, untranslatable_names())
  885: 
  886:     after
  887: 	catch peer:stop(Peer),
  888: 	file:set_cwd(OldCwd),
  889: 	[file:delete(F) || {_,F} <- untranslatable_names()],
  890: 	file:del_dir(Dir)
  891:     end,
  892:     ok.
  893: 
  894: untranslatable_names() ->
  895:     [{utf8,<<"abc">>},
  896:      {utf8,<<"def">>},
  897:      {utf8,<<"Lagerl",195,182,"f">>},
  898:      {utf8,<<195,150,"stra Emterwik">>},
  899:      {latin1,<<"M",229,"rbacka">>},
  900:      {latin1,<<"V",228,"rmland">>}].
  901: 
  902: call_and_sort(Node, M, F, A) ->
  903:     {ok,Res} = rpc:call(Node, M, F, A),
  904:     lists:sort(Res).
  905: 
  906: no_untranslatable_names() ->
  907:     case os:type() of
  908: 	{unix,darwin} -> os;
  909: 	{win32,_} -> os;
  910: 	_ ->
  911:             %% If we are using utf8only on zfs then we cannot create latin1 characters.
  912:             case os:find_executable("zfs") of
  913:                 false ->
  914:                     false;
  915:                 _Zfs ->
  916:                     case os:cmd("zfs get utf8only `pwd` | grep utf8only | awk '{print $3}'") of
  917:                         "on" ++ _ ->
  918:                             fs;
  919:                         _ ->
  920:                             false
  921:                     end
  922:             end
  923:     end.
  924: 
  925: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
  926: 
  927: 
  928: 
  929: open1(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  930:     RootDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir,Config),
  931:     NewDir = filename:join(RootDir,
  932: 			   atom_to_list(?MODULE)
  933: 			   ++"_files"),
  934:     ok = ?FILE_MODULE:make_dir(NewDir),
  935:     Name = filename:join(NewDir, "foo1.fil"),
  936:     {ok,Fd1} = ?FILE_MODULE:open(Name,read_write),
  937:     {ok,Fd2} = ?FILE_MODULE:open(Name,read),
  938:     Str = "{a,tuple}.\n",
  939:     io:format(Fd1,Str,[]),
  940:     {ok,0} = ?FILE_MODULE:position(Fd1,bof),
  941:     Str = io:get_line(Fd1,''),
  942:     Str = io:get_line(Fd2,''),
  943:     ok = ?FILE_MODULE:close(Fd2),
  944:     {ok,0} = ?FILE_MODULE:position(Fd1,bof),
  945:     ok = ?FILE_MODULE:truncate(Fd1),
  946:     eof = io:get_line(Fd1,''),
  947:     ok = ?FILE_MODULE:close(Fd1),
  948:     {ok,Fd3} = ?FILE_MODULE:open(Name,read),
  949:     eof = io:get_line(Fd3,''),
  950:     ok = ?FILE_MODULE:close(Fd3),
  951:     [] = flush(),
  952:     ok.
  953: 
  954: %% Tests all open modes.
  955: 
  956: old_modes(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  957:     RootDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
  958:     NewDir = filename:join(RootDir,
  959: 			   atom_to_list(?MODULE)
  960: 			   ++"_old_open_modes"),
  961:     ok = ?FILE_MODULE:make_dir(NewDir),
  962:     Name1 = filename:join(NewDir, "foo1.fil"),
  963:     Marker = "hello, world",
  964: 
  965:     %% write
  966:     {ok, Fd1} = ?FILE_MODULE:open(Name1, write),
  967:     ok = io:write(Fd1, Marker),
  968:     ok = io:put_chars(Fd1, ".\n"),
  969:     ok = ?FILE_MODULE:close(Fd1),
  970: 
  971:     %% read
  972:     {ok, Fd2} = ?FILE_MODULE:open(Name1, read),
  973:     {ok, Marker} = io:read(Fd2, prompt),
  974:     ok = ?FILE_MODULE:close(Fd2),
  975: 
  976:     %% read_write
  977:     {ok, Fd3} = ?FILE_MODULE:open(Name1, read_write),
  978:     {ok, Marker} = io:read(Fd3, prompt),
  979:     ok = io:write(Fd3, Marker),
  980:     ok = ?FILE_MODULE:close(Fd3),
  981: 
  982:     [] = flush(),
  983:     ok.
  984: 
  985: 
  986: new_modes(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  987:     RootDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
  988:     NewDir = filename:join(RootDir,
  989: 			   atom_to_list(?MODULE)
  990: 			   ++"_new_open_modes"),
  991:     ok = ?FILE_MODULE:make_dir(NewDir),
  992:     Name1 = filename:join(NewDir, "foo1.fil"),
  993:     Marker = "hello, world",
  994: 
  995:     %% write
  996:     {ok, Fd1} = ?FILE_MODULE:open(Name1, [write]),
  997:     ok = io:write(Fd1, Marker),
  998:     ok = io:put_chars(Fd1, ".\n"),
  999:     ok = ?FILE_MODULE:close(Fd1),
 1000: 
 1001:     %% read
 1002:     {ok, Fd2} = ?FILE_MODULE:open(Name1, [read]),
 1003:     {ok, Marker} = io:read(Fd2, prompt),
 1004:     ok = ?FILE_MODULE:close(Fd2),
 1005: 
 1006:     %% read and write
 1007:     {ok, Fd3} = ?FILE_MODULE:open(Name1, [read, write]),
 1008:     {ok, Marker} = io:read(Fd3, prompt),
 1009:     ok = io:write(Fd3, Marker),
 1010:     ok = ?FILE_MODULE:close(Fd3),
 1011: 
 1012:     %% read by default
 1013:     {ok, Fd4} = ?FILE_MODULE:open(Name1, []),
 1014:     {ok, Marker} = io:read(Fd4, prompt),
 1015:     ok = ?FILE_MODULE:close(Fd4),
 1016: 
 1017:     %% read and binary
 1018:     {ok, Fd5} = ?FILE_MODULE:open(Name1, [read, binary]),
 1019:     {ok, Marker} = io:read(Fd5, prompt),
 1020:     ok = ?FILE_MODULE:close(Fd5),
 1021: 
 1022:     %% read, raw
 1023:     {ok, Fd6} = ?FILE_MODULE:open(Name1, [read, raw]),
 1024:     {ok, [$\[]} = ?FILE_MODULE:read(Fd6, 1),
 1025:      ok = ?FILE_MODULE:close(Fd6),
 1026: 
 1027:      %% write and sync
 1028:      case ?FILE_MODULE:open(Name1, [write, sync]) of
 1029: 	 {ok, Fd7} ->
 1030: 	     ok = io:write(Fd7, Marker),
 1031: 	     ok = io:put_chars(Fd7, ".\n"),
 1032: 	     ok = ?FILE_MODULE:close(Fd7),
 1033: 	     {ok, Fd8} = ?FILE_MODULE:open(Name1, [read]),
 1034: 	     {ok, Marker} = io:read(Fd8, prompt),
 1035: 	     ok = ?FILE_MODULE:close(Fd8);
 1036: 	 {error, enotsup} ->
 1037: 	     %% for platforms that don't support the sync option
 1038: 	     ok
 1039:      end,
 1040: 
 1041:      % open directory
 1042:      {ok, Fd9} = ?FILE_MODULE:open(NewDir, [directory]),
 1043:      ok = ?FILE_MODULE:close(Fd9),
 1044: 
 1045:      % open raw directory
 1046:      {ok, Fd10} = ?FILE_MODULE:open(NewDir, [raw, directory]),
 1047:      ok = ?FILE_MODULE:close(Fd10),
 1048: 
 1049:      [] = flush(),
 1050:      ok.
 1051: 
 1052: path_open(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1053:     RootDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir,Config),
 1054:     NewDir = filename:join(RootDir,
 1055: 			   atom_to_list(?MODULE)
 1056: 			   ++"_path_open"),
 1057:     ok = ?FILE_MODULE:make_dir(NewDir),
 1058:     FileName = "path_open.fil",
 1059:     Name = filename:join(RootDir, FileName),
 1060:     {ok,Fd1,_FullName1} =
 1061: 	?FILE_MODULE:path_open(
 1062: 	   [RootDir,
 1063: 	    "nosuch1",
 1064: 	    NewDir],FileName,write),
 1065:     io:format(Fd1,"ABCDEFGH",[]),
 1066:     ok = ?FILE_MODULE:close(Fd1),
 1067: 
 1068:     %% locate it in the last dir
 1069:     {ok,Fd2,_FullName2} =
 1070: 	?FILE_MODULE:path_open(
 1071: 	   ["nosuch1",
 1072: 	    NewDir,
 1073: 	    RootDir],FileName,read),
 1074:     {ok,2} =
 1075: 	?FILE_MODULE:position(Fd2,2), "C" = io:get_chars(Fd2,'',1),
 1076:     ok = ?FILE_MODULE:close(Fd2),
 1077:     %% Try a failing path
 1078:     {error, enoent} = ?FILE_MODULE:path_open(
 1079: 			 ["nosuch1",
 1080: 			  NewDir],FileName,read),
 1081:     %% Check that it's found regardless of path, if an absolute name given
 1082:     {ok,Fd3,_FullPath3} =
 1083: 	?FILE_MODULE:path_open(
 1084: 	   ["nosuch1",
 1085: 	    NewDir],Name,read),
 1086:     {ok,2} =
 1087: 	?FILE_MODULE:position(Fd3,2), "C" = io:get_chars(Fd3,'',1),
 1088:     ok = ?FILE_MODULE:close(Fd3),
 1089: 
 1090:     [] = flush(),
 1091:     ok.
 1092: 
 1093: close(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1094:     RootDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir,Config),
 1095:     Name = filename:join(RootDir,
 1096: 			 atom_to_list(?MODULE)
 1097: 			 ++"_close.fil"),
 1098:     {ok,Fd1} = ?FILE_MODULE:open(Name,read_write),
 1099:     %% Just closing it is no fun, we did that a million times already
 1100:     %% This is a common error, for code written before Erlang 4.3
 1101:     %% because then ?FILE_MODULE:open just returned a Pid, and not everyone
 1102:     %% really checked what they got.
 1103:     {'EXIT',_Msg} = (catch ok = ?FILE_MODULE:close({ok,Fd1})),
 1104:     ok = ?FILE_MODULE:close(Fd1),
 1105: 
 1106:     %% Try closing one more time
 1107:     Val = ?FILE_MODULE:close(Fd1),
 1108:     io:format("Second close gave: ~p",[Val]),
 1109: 
 1110:     %% All operations on a closed raw file should EINVAL, even if they're not
 1111:     %% supported on the current platform.
 1112:     {ok,Fd2} = ?FILE_MODULE:open(Name, [read, write, raw]),
 1113:     ok = ?FILE_MODULE:close(Fd2),
 1114: 
 1115:     {error, einval} = ?FILE_MODULE:advise(Fd2, 5, 5, normal),
 1116:     {error, einval} = ?FILE_MODULE:allocate(Fd2, 5, 5),
 1117:     {error, einval} = ?FILE_MODULE:close(Fd2),
 1118:     {error, einval} = ?FILE_MODULE:datasync(Fd2),
 1119:     {error, einval} = ?FILE_MODULE:position(Fd2, 5),
 1120:     {error, einval} = ?FILE_MODULE:pread(Fd2, 5, 1),
 1121:     {error, einval} = ?FILE_MODULE:pwrite(Fd2, 5, "einval please"),
 1122:     {error, einval} = ?FILE_MODULE:read(Fd2, 1),
 1123:     {error, einval} = ?FILE_MODULE:sync(Fd2),
 1124:     {error, einval} = ?FILE_MODULE:truncate(Fd2),
 1125:     {error, einval} = ?FILE_MODULE:write(Fd2, "einval please"),
 1126: 
 1127:     [] = flush(),
 1128:     ok.
 1129: 
 1130: access(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1131:     RootDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir,Config),
 1132:     Name = filename:join(RootDir,
 1133: 			 atom_to_list(?MODULE)
 1134: 			 ++"_access.fil"),
 1135:     Str = "ABCDEFGH",
 1136:     {ok,Fd1} = ?FILE_MODULE:open(Name,write),
 1137:     io:format(Fd1,Str,[]),
 1138:     ok = ?FILE_MODULE:close(Fd1),
 1139:     %% Check that we can't write when in read only mode
 1140:     {ok,Fd2} = ?FILE_MODULE:open(Name,read),
 1141:     case catch io:format(Fd2,"XXXX",[]) of
 1142: 	ok ->
 1143: 	    ct:fail({format,write});
 1144: 	_ ->
 1145: 	    ok
 1146:     end,
 1147:     ok = ?FILE_MODULE:close(Fd2),
 1148:     {ok,Fd3} = ?FILE_MODULE:open(Name,read),
 1149:     Str = io:get_line(Fd3,''),
 1150:     ok = ?FILE_MODULE:close(Fd3),
 1151: 
 1152:     [] = flush(),
 1153:     ok.
 1154: 
 1155: %% Tests ?FILE_MODULE:read/2 and ?FILE_MODULE:write/2.
 1156: 
 1157: read_write(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1158:     RootDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
 1159:     NewDir = filename:join(RootDir,
 1160: 			   atom_to_list(?MODULE)
 1161: 			   ++"_read_write"),
 1162:     ok = ?FILE_MODULE:make_dir(NewDir),
 1163:     Marker = "hello, world",
 1164:     MarkerB = list_to_binary(Marker),
 1165: 
 1166:     %% Plain file.
 1167:     Name1 = filename:join(NewDir, "plain.fil"),
 1168:     {ok, Fd1} = ?FILE_MODULE:open(Name1, [read, write]),
 1169:     read_write_test(Fd1, Marker, []),
 1170: 
 1171:     %% Raw file.
 1172:     Name2 = filename:join(NewDir, "raw.fil"),
 1173:     {ok, Fd2} = ?FILE_MODULE:open(Name2, [read, write, raw]),
 1174:     read_write_test(Fd2, Marker, []),
 1175: 
 1176:     %% Plain binary file.
 1177:     Name3 = filename:join(NewDir, "plain-b.fil"),
 1178:     {ok, Fd3} = ?FILE_MODULE:open(Name3, [read, write, binary]),
 1179:     read_write_test(Fd3, MarkerB, <<>>),
 1180: 
 1181:     %% Raw binary file.
 1182:     Name4 = filename:join(NewDir, "raw-b.fil"),
 1183:     {ok, Fd4} = ?FILE_MODULE:open(Name4, [read, write, raw, binary]),
 1184:     read_write_test(Fd4, MarkerB, <<>>),
 1185: 
 1186:     ok.
 1187: 
 1188: read_write_test(File, Marker, Empty) ->
 1189:     ok = ?FILE_MODULE:write(File, Marker),
 1190:     {ok, 0} = ?FILE_MODULE:position(File, 0),
 1191:     {ok, Empty} = ?FILE_MODULE:read(File, 0),
 1192:     {ok, Marker} = ?FILE_MODULE:read(File, 100),
 1193:     eof = ?FILE_MODULE:read(File, 100),
 1194:     {ok, Empty} = ?FILE_MODULE:read(File, 0),
 1195:     ok = ?FILE_MODULE:close(File),
 1196:     [] = flush(),
 1197:     ok.
 1198: 
 1199: 
 1200: %% Tests ?FILE_MODULE:pread/2 and ?FILE_MODULE:pwrite/2.
 1201: 
 1202: pread_write(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1203:     RootDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
 1204:     NewDir = filename:join(RootDir,
 1205: 			   atom_to_list(?MODULE)
 1206: 			   ++"_pread_write"),
 1207:     ok = ?FILE_MODULE:make_dir(NewDir),
 1208:     List = "hello, world",
 1209:     Bin = list_to_binary(List),
 1210: 
 1211:     %% Plain file.
 1212:     Name1 = filename:join(NewDir, "plain.fil"),
 1213:     {ok, Fd1} = ?FILE_MODULE:open(Name1, [read, write]),
 1214:     pread_write_test(Fd1, List),
 1215: 
 1216:     %% Raw file.
 1217:     Name2 = filename:join(NewDir, "raw.fil"),
 1218:     {ok, Fd2} = ?FILE_MODULE:open(Name2, [read, write, raw]),
 1219:     pread_write_test(Fd2, List),
 1220: 
 1221:     %% Plain file. Binary mode.
 1222:     Name3 = filename:join(NewDir, "plain-binary.fil"),
 1223:     {ok, Fd3} = ?FILE_MODULE:open(Name3, [binary, read, write]),
 1224:     pread_write_test(Fd3, Bin),
 1225: 
 1226:     %% Raw file. Binary mode.
 1227:     Name4 = filename:join(NewDir, "raw-binary.fil"),
 1228:     {ok, Fd4} = ?FILE_MODULE:open(Name4, [binary, read, write, raw]),
 1229:     pread_write_test(Fd4, Bin),
 1230: 
 1231:     ok.
 1232: 
 1233: pread_write_test(File, Data) ->
 1234:     io:format("~p:pread_write_test(~p,~p)~n", [?MODULE, File, Data]),
 1235:     Size = if is_binary(Data) -> byte_size(Data);
 1236: 	      is_list(Data) -> length(Data)
 1237: 	   end,
 1238:     I = Size + 17,
 1239:     ok = ?FILE_MODULE:pwrite(File, 0, Data),
 1240:     {ok, Data} = ?FILE_MODULE:pread(File, 0, I),
 1241:     {ok, [Data]} = ?FILE_MODULE:pread(File, [{0, I}]),
 1242:     eof = ?FILE_MODULE:pread(File, I, 1),
 1243:     ok = ?FILE_MODULE:pwrite(File, [{0, Data}, {I, Data}]),
 1244:     {ok, [Data, eof, Data]} =
 1245: 	?FILE_MODULE:pread(File, [{0, Size}, {2*I, 1}, {I, Size}]),
 1246:     Plist = lists:seq(21*I, 0, -I),
 1247:     Pwrite = lists:map(fun(P)->{P,Data}end, Plist),
 1248:     Pread = [{22*I,Size} | lists:map(fun(P)->{P,Size}end, Plist)],
 1249:     Presult = [eof | lists:map(fun(_)->Data end, Plist)],
 1250:     ok = ?FILE_MODULE:pwrite(File, Pwrite),
 1251:     {ok, Presult} = ?FILE_MODULE:pread(File, Pread),
 1252:     ok = ?FILE_MODULE:close(File),
 1253:     [] = flush(),
 1254:     ok.
 1255: 
 1256: %% Test appending to a file.
 1257: append(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1258:     RootDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
 1259:     NewDir = filename:join(RootDir,
 1260: 			   atom_to_list(?MODULE)
 1261: 			   ++"_append"),
 1262:     ok = ?FILE_MODULE:make_dir(NewDir),
 1263: 
 1264:     First = "First line\n",
 1265:     Second = "Second lines comes here\n",
 1266:     Third = "And here is the third line\n",
 1267: 
 1268:     %% Write a small text file.
 1269:     Name1 = filename:join(NewDir, "a_file.txt"),
 1270:     {ok, Fd1} = ?FILE_MODULE:open(Name1, [write]),
 1271:     ok = io:format(Fd1, First, []),
 1272:     ok = io:format(Fd1, Second, []),
 1273:     ok = ?FILE_MODULE:close(Fd1),
 1274: 
 1275:     %% Open it a again and a append a line to it.
 1276:     {ok, Fd2} = ?FILE_MODULE:open(Name1, [append]),
 1277:     ok = io:format(Fd2, Third, []),
 1278:     ok = ?FILE_MODULE:close(Fd2),
 1279: 
 1280:     %% Read it back and verify.
 1281:     Expected = list_to_binary([First, Second, Third]),
 1282:     {ok, Expected} = ?FILE_MODULE:read_file(Name1),
 1283: 
 1284:     [] = flush(),
 1285:     ok.
 1286: 
 1287: open_errors(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1288:     DataDir =
 1289: 	filename:dirname(
 1290: 	  filename:join(proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config), "x")),
 1291:     DataDirSlash = DataDir++"/",
 1292:     {error, E1} = ?FILE_MODULE:open(DataDir, [read]),
 1293:     {error, E2} = ?FILE_MODULE:open(DataDirSlash, [read]),
 1294:     {error, E3} = ?FILE_MODULE:open(DataDir, [write]),
 1295:     {error, E4} = ?FILE_MODULE:open(DataDirSlash, [write]),
 1296:     {eisdir,eisdir,eisdir,eisdir} = {E1,E2,E3,E4},
 1297: 
 1298:     Real = filename:join(DataDir, "realmen.html"),
 1299:     {error, enotdir} = ?FILE_MODULE:open(Real, [directory]),
 1300: 
 1301:     {'EXIT', {badarg, _}} = (catch ?FILE_MODULE:open("foo", [raw, ram])),
 1302:     [] = flush(),
 1303:     ok.
 1304: 
 1305: %% Test exclusive access to a file.
 1306: exclusive(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1307:     RootDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir,Config),
 1308:     NewDir = filename:join(RootDir,
 1309: 			   atom_to_list(?MODULE)
 1310: 			   ++"_exclusive"),
 1311:     ok = ?FILE_MODULE:make_dir(NewDir),
 1312:     Name = filename:join(NewDir, "ex_file.txt"),
 1313:     {ok, Fd} = ?FILE_MODULE:open(Name, [write, exclusive]),
 1314:     {error, eexist} = ?FILE_MODULE:open(Name, [write, exclusive]),
 1315:     ok = ?FILE_MODULE:close(Fd),
 1316:     ok.
 1317: 
 1318: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
 1319: 
 1320: 
 1321: pos1(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1322:     RootDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir,Config),
 1323:     Name = filename:join(RootDir,
 1324: 			 atom_to_list(?MODULE)
 1325: 			 ++"_pos1.fil"),
 1326:     {ok,Fd1} = ?FILE_MODULE:open(Name,write),
 1327:     io:format(Fd1,"ABCDEFGH",[]),
 1328:     ok = ?FILE_MODULE:close(Fd1),
 1329:     {ok,Fd2} = ?FILE_MODULE:open(Name,read),
 1330: 
 1331:     %% Start pos is first char
 1332:     io:format("Relative positions"),
 1333:     "A" = io:get_chars(Fd2,'',1),
 1334:     {ok,2} = ?FILE_MODULE:position(Fd2,{cur,1}),
 1335:     "C" = io:get_chars(Fd2,'',1),
 1336:     {ok,0} = ?FILE_MODULE:position(Fd2,{cur,-3}),
 1337:     "A" = io:get_chars(Fd2,'',1),
 1338:     %% Backwards from first char should be an error
 1339:     {ok,0} = ?FILE_MODULE:position(Fd2,{cur,-1}),
 1340:     {error, einval} = ?FILE_MODULE:position(Fd2,{cur,-1}),
 1341:     %% Reset position and move again
 1342:     {ok,0} = ?FILE_MODULE:position(Fd2,0),
 1343:     {ok,2} = ?FILE_MODULE:position(Fd2,{cur,2}),
 1344:     "C" = io:get_chars(Fd2,'',1),
 1345:     %% Go a lot forwards
 1346:     {ok,13} = ?FILE_MODULE:position(Fd2,{cur,10}),
 1347:     eof = io:get_chars(Fd2,'',1),
 1348: 
 1349:     %% Try some fixed positions
 1350:     io:format("Fixed positions"),
 1351:     {ok,8} =
 1352: 	?FILE_MODULE:position(Fd2,8), eof = io:get_chars(Fd2,'',1),
 1353:     {ok,8} =
 1354: 	?FILE_MODULE:position(Fd2,cur), eof = io:get_chars(Fd2,'',1),
 1355:     {ok,7} =
 1356: 	?FILE_MODULE:position(Fd2,7), "H" = io:get_chars(Fd2,'',1),
 1357:     {ok,0} =
 1358: 	?FILE_MODULE:position(Fd2,0), "A" = io:get_chars(Fd2,'',1),
 1359:     {ok,3} =
 1360: 	?FILE_MODULE:position(Fd2,3), "D" = io:get_chars(Fd2,'',1),
 1361:     {ok,12} =
 1362: 	?FILE_MODULE:position(Fd2,12), eof = io:get_chars(Fd2,'',1),
 1363:     {ok,3} =
 1364: 	?FILE_MODULE:position(Fd2,3), "D" = io:get_chars(Fd2,'',1),
 1365:     %% Try the {bof,X} notation
 1366:     {ok,3} = ?FILE_MODULE:position(Fd2,{bof,3}),
 1367:     "D" = io:get_chars(Fd2,'',1),
 1368: 
 1369:     %% Try eof positions
 1370:     io:format("EOF positions"),
 1371:     {ok,8} =
 1372: 	?FILE_MODULE:position(Fd2,{eof,0}), eof=io:get_chars(Fd2,'',1),
 1373:     {ok,7} =
 1374: 	?FILE_MODULE:position(Fd2,{eof,-1}),
 1375:     "H" = io:get_chars(Fd2,'',1),
 1376:     {ok,0} =
 1377: 	?FILE_MODULE:position(Fd2,{eof,-8}), "A"=io:get_chars(Fd2,'',1),
 1378:     {error, einval} = ?FILE_MODULE:position(Fd2,{eof,-9}),
 1379: 
 1380:     [] = flush(),
 1381:     ok.
 1382: 
 1383: pos2(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1384:     RootDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir,Config),
 1385:     Name = filename:join(RootDir,
 1386: 			 atom_to_list(?MODULE)
 1387: 			 ++"_pos2.fil"),
 1388:     {ok,Fd1} = ?FILE_MODULE:open(Name,write),
 1389:     io:format(Fd1,"ABCDEFGH",[]),
 1390:     ok = ?FILE_MODULE:close(Fd1),
 1391:     {ok,Fd2} = ?FILE_MODULE:open(Name,read),
 1392:     {error, einval} = ?FILE_MODULE:position(Fd2,-1),
 1393: 
 1394:     %% Make sure that we still can search after an error.
 1395:     {ok,0} = ?FILE_MODULE:position(Fd2, 0),
 1396:     {ok,3} = ?FILE_MODULE:position(Fd2, {bof,3}),
 1397:     "D" = io:get_chars(Fd2,'',1),
 1398: 
 1399:     [] = flush(),
 1400:     io:format("DONE"),
 1401:     ok.
 1402: 
 1403: %% When it does not use raw mode, file:position had a bug.
 1404: pos3(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1405:     RootDir = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
 1406:     Name = filename:join(RootDir, "realmen.html.gz"),
 1407: 
 1408:     {ok, Fd} = ?FILE_MODULE:open(Name, [read, binary]),
 1409:     {ok, _}  = ?FILE_MODULE:read(Fd, 5),
 1410:     {error, einval} = ?FILE_MODULE:position(Fd, {bof, -1}),
 1411: 
 1412:     %% Here ok had returned =(
 1413:     {error, einval} = ?FILE_MODULE:position(Fd, {cur, -10}),
 1414:     %% That test is actually questionable since file:position/2
 1415:     %% is documented to leave the file position undefined after
 1416:     %% it has returned an error.  But on Posix systems the position
 1417:     %% is guaranteed to be unchanged after an error return.  On e.g
 1418:     %% Windows there is nothing stated about this in the documentation.
 1419: 
 1420:     ok.
 1421: 
 1422: file_info_basic_file(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1423:     RootDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
 1424: 
 1425:     %% Create a short file.
 1426:     Name = filename:join(RootDir,
 1427: 			 atom_to_list(?MODULE) ++ "_" ++
 1428:                          atom_to_list(?FUNCTION_NAME) ++ ".fil"),
 1429:     {ok,Fd1} = ?FILE_MODULE:open(Name, write),
 1430:     io:put_chars(Fd1, "foo bar"),
 1431:     ok = ?FILE_MODULE:close(Fd1),
 1432: 
 1433:     %% Don't crash the file server when passing incorrect arguments.
 1434:     {error,badarg} = ?FILE_MODULE:read_file_info(Name, [{time, gurka}]),
 1435:     {error,badarg} = ?FILE_MODULE:read_file_info([#{} | gaffel]),
 1436: 
 1437:     %% Test that the file has the expected attributes.
 1438:     %% The times are tricky, so we will save them to a separate test case.
 1439:     {ok,FileInfo} = ?FILE_MODULE:read_file_info(Name),
 1440:     {ok,FileInfo} = ?FILE_MODULE:read_file_info(Name, [raw]),
 1441:     #file_info{size=Size,type=Type,access=Access,
 1442: 	       atime=AccessTime,mtime=ModifyTime} = FileInfo,
 1443:     io:format("Access ~p, Modify ~p", [AccessTime, ModifyTime]),
 1444:     Size = 7,
 1445:     Type = regular,
 1446:     read_write = Access,
 1447:     true = abs(time_dist(filter_atime(AccessTime, Config),
 1448: 			 filter_atime(ModifyTime,
 1449: 				      Config))) < 2,
 1450:     all_integers(tuple_to_list(AccessTime) ++ tuple_to_list(ModifyTime)),
 1451: 
 1452:     [] = flush(),
 1453:     ok.
 1454: 
 1455: file_info_basic_directory(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1456:     %% Note: filename:join/1 removes any trailing slash,
 1457:     %% which is essential for ?FILE_MODULE:file_info/1 to work on
 1458:     %% platforms such as Windows95.
 1459:     RootDir = filename:join([proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config)]),
 1460: 
 1461:     %% Test that the RootDir directory has the expected attributes.
 1462:     test_directory(RootDir, read_write),
 1463: 
 1464:     %% Note that on Windows file systems, 
 1465:     %% "/" or "c:/" are *NOT* directories.
 1466:     %% Therefore, test that ?FILE_MODULE:file_info/1 behaves as if they were
 1467:     %% directories.
 1468:     case os:type() of
 1469:         {win32, _} ->
 1470:             test_directory("/", read_write),
 1471:             test_directory("c:/", read_write),
 1472:             test_directory("c:\\", read_write),
 1473:             test_directory("\\\\localhost\\c$", read_write);
 1474:         _ ->
 1475:             test_directory("/", read)
 1476:     end,
 1477:     ok.
 1478: 
 1479: test_directory(Name, ExpectedAccess) ->
 1480:     {ok,FileInfo} = ?FILE_MODULE:read_file_info(Name),
 1481:     {ok,FileInfo} = ?FILE_MODULE:read_file_info(Name, [raw]),
 1482:     #file_info{size=Size,type=Type,access=Access,
 1483:                atime=AccessTime,mtime=ModifyTime} = FileInfo,
 1484:     io:format("Testing directory ~s", [Name]),
 1485:     io:format("Directory size is ~p", [Size]),
 1486:     io:format("Access ~p", [Access]),
 1487:     io:format("Access time ~p; Modify time~p",
 1488: 	      [AccessTime, ModifyTime]),
 1489:     Type = directory,
 1490:     Access = ExpectedAccess,
 1491:     all_integers(tuple_to_list(AccessTime) ++ tuple_to_list(ModifyTime)),
 1492:     [] = flush(),
 1493:     ok.
 1494: 
 1495: all_integers([{A,B,C}|T]) ->
 1496:     all_integers([A,B,C|T]);
 1497: all_integers([Int|Rest]) when is_integer(Int) ->
 1498:     all_integers(Rest);
 1499: all_integers([]) -> ok.
 1500: 
 1501: %% Try something nonexistent.
 1502: 
 1503: file_info_bad(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1504:     RootDir = filename:join([proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config)]),
 1505:     FileName = filename:join(RootDir, atom_to_list(?MODULE) ++ "_nonexistent"),
 1506:     {error,enoent} = ?FILE_MODULE:read_file_info(FileName),
 1507:     {error,enoent} = ?FILE_MODULE:read_file_info(FileName, [raw]),
 1508:     {error, enoent} = ?FILE_MODULE:read_file_info(""),
 1509:     {error, enoent} = ?FILE_MODULE:read_file_info("", [raw]),
 1510:     [] = flush(),
 1511:     ok.
 1512: 
 1513: %% Test that the file times behave as they should.
 1514: 
 1515: file_info_times(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1516:     %% We have to try this twice, since if the test runs across the change
 1517:     %% of a month the time diff calculations will fail. But it won't happen
 1518:     %% if you run it twice in succession.
 1519:     test_server:m_out_of_n(
 1520:       1,2,
 1521:       fun() -> file_info_int(Config) end),
 1522:     ok.
 1523: 
 1524: file_info_int(Config) ->
 1525:     %% Note: filename:join/1 removes any trailing slash,
 1526:     %% which is essential for ?FILE_MODULE:file_info/1 to work on
 1527:     %% platforms such as Windows95.
 1528: 
 1529:     RootDir = filename:join([proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config)]),
 1530:     io:format("RootDir = ~p", [RootDir]),
 1531: 
 1532:     Name = filename:join(RootDir,
 1533: 			 atom_to_list(?MODULE) ++ "_" ++
 1534:                          atom_to_list(?FUNCTION_NAME) ++ ".fil"),
 1535:     {ok,Fd1} = ?FILE_MODULE:open(Name,write),
 1536:     io:put_chars(Fd1,"foo"),
 1537: 
 1538:     %% check that the file got a modify date max a few seconds away from now
 1539:     {ok,FileInfo1} = ?FILE_MODULE:read_file_info(Name),
 1540:     {ok,FileInfo1Raw} = ?FILE_MODULE:read_file_info(Name, [raw]),
 1541: 
 1542:     %% We assert that everything but the size is the same, on some OSs the
 1543:     %% size may not have been flushed to disc and we do not want to do a
 1544:     %% sync to force it.
 1545:     FileInfo1Raw = FileInfo1#file_info{ size = FileInfo1Raw#file_info.size },
 1546: 
 1547:     #file_info{type=regular,atime=AccTime1,mtime=ModTime1} = FileInfo1,
 1548: 
 1549:     Now = erlang:localtime(), %???
 1550:     io:format("Now ~p",[Now]),
 1551:     io:format("Open file Acc ~p Mod ~p",[AccTime1,ModTime1]),
 1552:     true = abs(time_dist(filter_atime(Now, Config),
 1553: 			 filter_atime(AccTime1,
 1554: 				      Config))) < 8,
 1555:     true = abs(time_dist(Now,ModTime1)) < 8,
 1556: 
 1557:     %% Sleep until we can be sure the seconds value has changed.
 1558:     %% Note: FAT-based filesystem (like on Windows 95) have
 1559:     %% a resolution of 2 seconds.
 1560:     timer:sleep(2200),
 1561: 
 1562:     %% close the file, and watch the modify date change
 1563:     ok = ?FILE_MODULE:close(Fd1),
 1564:     {ok,FileInfo2} = ?FILE_MODULE:read_file_info(Name),
 1565:     {ok,FileInfo2} = ?FILE_MODULE:read_file_info(Name, [raw]),
 1566:     #file_info{size=Size,type=regular,access=Access,
 1567:                atime=AccTime2,mtime=ModTime2} = FileInfo2,
 1568:     io:format("Closed file Acc ~p Mod ~p",[AccTime2,ModTime2]),
 1569:     true = time_dist(ModTime1,ModTime2) >= 0,
 1570: 
 1571:     %% this file is supposed to be binary, so it'd better keep it's size
 1572:     Size = 3,
 1573:     Access = read_write,
 1574: 
 1575:     %% Do some directory checking
 1576:     {ok,FileInfo3} = ?FILE_MODULE:read_file_info(RootDir),
 1577:     {ok,FileInfo3} = ?FILE_MODULE:read_file_info(RootDir, [raw]),
 1578:     #file_info{size=DSize,type=directory,access=DAccess,
 1579:                atime=AccTime3,mtime=ModTime3} = FileInfo3,
 1580:     %% this dir was modified only a few secs ago
 1581:     io:format("Dir Acc ~p; Mod ~p; Now ~p", [AccTime3, ModTime3, Now]),
 1582:     true = abs(time_dist(Now,ModTime3)) < 5,
 1583:     DAccess = read_write,
 1584:     io:format("Dir size is ~p",[DSize]),
 1585: 
 1586:     [] = flush(),
 1587:     ok.
 1588: 
 1589: %% Filter access times, to copy with a deficiency of FAT file systems
 1590: %% (on Windows): The access time is actually only a date.
 1591: 
 1592: filter_atime(Atime, Config) ->
 1593:     case lists:member(no_access_time, Config) of
 1594: 	true ->
 1595: 	    case Atime of
 1596: 	    	{Date, _} ->
 1597: 		    {Date, {0, 0, 0}};
 1598: 		{Y, M, D, _, _, _} ->
 1599: 		    {Y, M, D, 0, 0, 0}
 1600: 	    end;
 1601: 	false ->
 1602: 	    Atime
 1603:     end.
 1604: 
 1605: %% Test read_file_info on I/O devices.
 1606: 
 1607: file_handle_info_basic_file(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1608:     RootDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
 1609: 
 1610:     %% Create a short file.
 1611:     Name = filename:join(RootDir,
 1612: 			 atom_to_list(?MODULE) ++ "_" ++
 1613: 			 atom_to_list(?FUNCTION_NAME) ++ ".fil"),
 1614:     {ok,Fd1} = ?FILE_MODULE:open(Name, write),
 1615:     io:put_chars(Fd1, "foo bar"),
 1616:     ok = ?FILE_MODULE:close(Fd1),
 1617: 
 1618:     %% Test that the file has the expected attributes.
 1619:     %% The times are tricky, so we will save them to a separate test case.
 1620: 
 1621:     {ok, Fd} = ?FILE_MODULE:open(Name, read),
 1622:     {ok,FileInfo} = ?FILE_MODULE:read_file_info(Fd),
 1623:     ok = ?FILE_MODULE:close(Fd),
 1624: 
 1625:     {ok, FdRaw} = ?FILE_MODULE:open(Name, [read, raw]),
 1626:     {ok,FileInfoRaw} = ?FILE_MODULE:read_file_info(FdRaw),
 1627:     ok = ?FILE_MODULE:close(FdRaw),
 1628: 
 1629:     #file_info{size=Size,type=Type,access=Access,
 1630: 	       atime=AccessTime,mtime=ModifyTime} = FileInfo = FileInfoRaw,
 1631:     io:format("Access ~p, Modify ~p", [AccessTime, ModifyTime]),
 1632:     Size = 7,
 1633:     Type = regular,
 1634:     read_write = Access,
 1635:     true = abs(time_dist(filter_atime(AccessTime, Config),
 1636: 			 filter_atime(ModifyTime,
 1637: 				      Config))) < 5,
 1638:     all_integers(tuple_to_list(AccessTime) ++ tuple_to_list(ModifyTime)),
 1639: 
 1640:     [] = flush(),
 1641:     ok.
 1642: 
 1643: file_handle_info_basic_directory(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1644:     %% Note: filename:join/1 removes any trailing slash,
 1645:     %% which is essential for ?FILE_MODULE:file_info/1 to work on
 1646:     %% platforms such as Windows95.
 1647:     RootDir = filename:join([proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config)]),
 1648: 
 1649:     %% Test that the RootDir directory has the expected attributes.
 1650:     test_directory_handle(RootDir, read_write),
 1651: 
 1652:     %% Note that on Windows file systems,
 1653:     %% "/" or "c:/" are *NOT* directories.
 1654:     %% Therefore, test that ?FILE_MODULE:file_info/1 behaves as if they were
 1655:     %% directories.
 1656:     case os:type() of
 1657:         {win32, _} ->
 1658:             test_directory_handle("/", read_write),
 1659:             test_directory_handle("c:/", read_write),
 1660:             test_directory_handle("c:\\", read_write),
 1661:             test_directory_handle("\\\\localhost\\c$", read_write);
 1662:         _ ->
 1663:             test_directory_handle("/", read)
 1664:     end,
 1665:     ok.
 1666: 
 1667: test_directory_handle(Name, ExpectedAccess) ->
 1668:     {ok, DirFd} = file:open(Name, [read, directory]),
 1669:     try
 1670:         {ok,FileInfo} = ?FILE_MODULE:read_file_info(DirFd),
 1671:         {ok,FileInfo} = ?FILE_MODULE:read_file_info(DirFd, [raw]),
 1672:         #file_info{size=Size,type=Type,access=Access,
 1673:                    atime=AccessTime,mtime=ModifyTime} = FileInfo,
 1674:         io:format("Testing directory ~s", [Name]),
 1675:         io:format("Directory size is ~p", [Size]),
 1676:         io:format("Access ~p", [Access]),
 1677:         io:format("Access time ~p; Modify time~p",
 1678:                   [AccessTime, ModifyTime]),
 1679:         Type = directory,
 1680:         Access = ExpectedAccess,
 1681:         all_integers(tuple_to_list(AccessTime) ++ tuple_to_list(ModifyTime)),
 1682:         [] = flush(),
 1683:         ok
 1684:     after
 1685:         file:close(DirFd)
 1686:     end.
 1687: 
 1688: %% Test that the file times behave as they should.
 1689: 
 1690: file_handle_info_times(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1691:     %% We have to try this twice, since if the test runs across the change
 1692:     %% of a month the time diff calculations will fail. But it won't happen
 1693:     %% if you run it twice in succession.
 1694:     test_server:m_out_of_n(
 1695:       1,2,
 1696:       fun() -> file_handle_info_int(Config) end),
 1697:     ok.
 1698: 
 1699: file_handle_info_int(Config) ->
 1700:     %% Note: filename:join/1 removes any trailing slash,
 1701:     %% which is essential for ?FILE_MODULE:file_info/1 to work on
 1702:     %% platforms such as Windows95.
 1703: 
 1704:     RootDir = filename:join([proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config)]),
 1705:     io:format("RootDir = ~p", [RootDir]),
 1706: 
 1707:     Name = filename:join(RootDir,
 1708: 			 atom_to_list(?MODULE) ++ "_" ++
 1709: 			 atom_to_list(?FUNCTION_NAME) ++ ".fil"),
 1710:     {ok,Fd1} = ?FILE_MODULE:open(Name, write),
 1711:     io:put_chars(Fd1,"foo"),
 1712:     {ok,FileInfo1} = ?FILE_MODULE:read_file_info(Fd1),
 1713:     ok = ?FILE_MODULE:close(Fd1),
 1714: 
 1715:     {ok,Fd1Raw} = ?FILE_MODULE:open(Name, [read, raw]),
 1716:     {ok,FileInfo1Raw} = ?FILE_MODULE:read_file_info(Fd1Raw),
 1717:     ok = ?FILE_MODULE:close(Fd1Raw),
 1718: 
 1719:     %% We assert that everything but the size is the same, on some OSs the
 1720:     %% size may not have been flushed to disc and we do not want to do a
 1721:     %% sync to force it.
 1722:     FileInfo1Raw = FileInfo1#file_info{ size = FileInfo1Raw#file_info.size },
 1723: 
 1724:     #file_info{type=regular,atime=AccTime1,mtime=ModTime1} = FileInfo1,
 1725: 
 1726:     Now = erlang:localtime(), %???
 1727:     io:format("Now ~p",[Now]),
 1728:     io:format("Open file Acc ~p Mod ~p",[AccTime1,ModTime1]),
 1729:     true = abs(time_dist(filter_atime(Now, Config),
 1730: 			 filter_atime(AccTime1,
 1731: 				      Config))) < 8,
 1732:     true = abs(time_dist(Now,ModTime1)) < 8,
 1733: 
 1734:     %% Sleep until we can be sure the seconds value has changed.
 1735:     %% Note: FAT-based filesystem (like on Windows 95) have
 1736:     %% a resolution of 2 seconds.
 1737:     timer:sleep(2200),
 1738: 
 1739:     %% close the file, and watch the modify date change
 1740: 
 1741:     {ok,Fd2} = ?FILE_MODULE:open(Name, read),
 1742:     {ok,FileInfo2} = ?FILE_MODULE:read_file_info(Fd2),
 1743:     ok = ?FILE_MODULE:close(Fd2),
 1744: 
 1745:     {ok,Fd2Raw} = ?FILE_MODULE:open(Name, [read, raw]),
 1746:     {ok,FileInfo2Raw} = ?FILE_MODULE:read_file_info(Fd2Raw),
 1747:     ok = ?FILE_MODULE:close(Fd2Raw),
 1748: 
 1749:     #file_info{size=Size,type=regular,access=Access,
 1750:                atime=AccTime2,mtime=ModTime2} = FileInfo2 = FileInfo2Raw,
 1751:     io:format("Closed file Acc ~p Mod ~p",[AccTime2,ModTime2]),
 1752:     true = time_dist(ModTime1,ModTime2) >= 0,
 1753: 
 1754:     %% this file is supposed to be binary, so it'd better keep it's size
 1755:     Size = 3,
 1756:     Access = read_write,
 1757: 
 1758:     %% Do some directory checking
 1759: 
 1760:     {ok,Fd3} = ?FILE_MODULE:open(RootDir, [read, directory]),
 1761:     {ok,FileInfo3} = ?FILE_MODULE:read_file_info(Fd3),
 1762:     ok = ?FILE_MODULE:close(Fd3),
 1763: 
 1764:     {ok,Fd3Raw} = ?FILE_MODULE:open(RootDir, [read, directory, raw]),
 1765:     {ok,FileInfo3Raw} = ?FILE_MODULE:read_file_info(Fd3Raw),
 1766:     ok = ?FILE_MODULE:close(Fd3Raw),
 1767: 
 1768:     #file_info{size=DSize,type=directory,access=DAccess,
 1769:                atime=AccTime3,mtime=ModTime3} = FileInfo3 = FileInfo3Raw,
 1770:     %% this dir was modified only a few secs ago
 1771:     io:format("Dir Acc ~p; Mod ~p; Now ~p", [AccTime3, ModTime3, Now]),
 1772:     true = abs(time_dist(Now,ModTime3)) < 5,
 1773:     DAccess = read_write,
 1774:     io:format("Dir size is ~p",[DSize]),
 1775: 
 1776:     [] = flush(),
 1777:     ok.
 1778: 
 1779: %% Test the write_file_info/2 function.
 1780: 
 1781: file_write_file_info(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1782:     RootDir = get_good_directory(Config),
 1783:     io:format("RootDir = ~p", [RootDir]),
 1784: 
 1785:     %% Set the file to read only AND update the file times at the same time.
 1786:     %% (This used to fail on Windows NT/95 for a local filesystem.)
 1787:     %% Note: Seconds must be even; see note in file_info_times/1.
 1788: 
 1789:     Name1 = filename:join(RootDir,
 1790: 			  atom_to_list(?MODULE)
 1791: 			  ++"_write_file_info_ro"),
 1792:     ok = ?FILE_MODULE:write_file(Name1, "hello"),
 1793:     Time = {{1997, 01, 02}, {12, 35, 42}},
 1794:     Info = #file_info{mode=8#400, atime=Time, mtime=Time, ctime=Time},
 1795:     ok = ?FILE_MODULE:write_file_info(Name1, Info),
 1796: 
 1797:     %% Read back the times.
 1798: 
 1799:     {ok, ActualInfo} = ?FILE_MODULE:read_file_info(Name1),
 1800:     #file_info{mode=_Mode, atime=ActAtime, mtime=Time,
 1801: 	       ctime=ActCtime} = ActualInfo,
 1802:     FilteredAtime = filter_atime(Time, Config),
 1803:     FilteredAtime = filter_atime(ActAtime, Config),
 1804:     case os:type() of
 1805: 	{win32, _} ->
 1806: 	    %% On Windows, "ctime" means creation time and it can
 1807: 	    %% be set.
 1808: 	    ActCtime = Time;
 1809: 	_ ->
 1810: 	    ok
 1811:     end,
 1812:     {error, eacces} = ?FILE_MODULE:write_file(Name1, "hello again"),
 1813: 
 1814:     %% Make the file writable again.
 1815: 
 1816:     ?FILE_MODULE:write_file_info(Name1, #file_info{mode=8#600}),
 1817:     ok = ?FILE_MODULE:write_file(Name1, "hello again"),
 1818: 
 1819:     %% And unwritable.
 1820:     ?FILE_MODULE:write_file_info(Name1, #file_info{mode=8#400}),
 1821:     {error, eacces} = ?FILE_MODULE:write_file(Name1, "hello again"),
 1822: 
 1823:     %% Same with raw.
 1824:     ?FILE_MODULE:write_file_info(Name1, #file_info{mode=8#600}, [raw]),
 1825:     ok = ?FILE_MODULE:write_file(Name1, "hello again"),
 1826:     ?FILE_MODULE:write_file_info(Name1, #file_info{mode=8#400}, [raw]),
 1827:     {error,eacces} = ?FILE_MODULE:write_file(Name1, "hello again"),
 1828: 
 1829:     %% Write the times again.
 1830:     %% Note: Seconds must be even; see note in file_info_times/1.
 1831: 
 1832:     NewTime = {{1997, 02, 15}, {13, 18, 20}},
 1833:     NewInfo = #file_info{atime=NewTime, mtime=NewTime, ctime=NewTime},
 1834:     ok = ?FILE_MODULE:write_file_info(Name1, NewInfo),
 1835:     {ok, ActualInfo2} = ?FILE_MODULE:read_file_info(Name1),
 1836:     #file_info{atime=NewActAtime, mtime=NewTime,
 1837: 	       ctime=NewActCtime} = ActualInfo2,
 1838:     NewFilteredAtime = filter_atime(NewTime, Config),
 1839:     NewFilteredAtime = filter_atime(NewActAtime, Config),
 1840:     case os:type() of
 1841: 	{win32, _} -> NewActCtime = NewTime;
 1842: 	_ -> ok
 1843:     end,
 1844: 
 1845:     %% The file should still be unwritable.
 1846:     {error, eacces} = ?FILE_MODULE:write_file(Name1, "hello again"),
 1847: 
 1848:     %% Make the file writeable again, so that we can remove the
 1849:     %% test suites ... :-)
 1850:     ?FILE_MODULE:write_file_info(Name1, #file_info{mode=8#600}),
 1851: 
 1852:     [] = flush(),
 1853:     ok.
 1854: 
 1855: file_wfi_helpers(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1856:     RootDir = get_good_directory(Config),
 1857:     io:format("RootDir = ~p", [RootDir]),
 1858: 
 1859:     Name = filename:join(RootDir,
 1860:                          atom_to_list(?MODULE) ++ "_wfi_helpers"),
 1861: 
 1862:     ok = ?FILE_MODULE:write_file(Name, "hello again"),
 1863:     NewTime = {{1997, 02, 15}, {13, 18, 20}},
 1864:     ok = ?FILE_MODULE:change_time(Name, NewTime, NewTime),
 1865: 
 1866:     {ok, #file_info{atime=NewActAtime, mtime=NewTime}} =
 1867:         ?FILE_MODULE:read_file_info(Name),
 1868: 
 1869:     NewFilteredAtime = filter_atime(NewTime, Config),
 1870:     NewFilteredAtime = filter_atime(NewActAtime, Config),
 1871: 
 1872:     %% Make the file unwritable
 1873:     ok = ?FILE_MODULE:change_mode(Name, 8#400),
 1874:     {error, eacces} = ?FILE_MODULE:write_file(Name, "hello again"),
 1875: 
 1876:     %% ... and writable again
 1877:     ok = ?FILE_MODULE:change_mode(Name, 8#600),
 1878:     ok = ?FILE_MODULE:write_file(Name, "hello again"),
 1879: 
 1880:     %% We have no idea which users will work, so all we can do is to check
 1881:     %% that it returns enoent instead of crashing.
 1882:     {error, enoent} = ?FILE_MODULE:change_group("bogus file name", 0),
 1883:     {error, enoent} = ?FILE_MODULE:change_owner("bogus file name", 0),
 1884: 
 1885:     [] = flush(),
 1886:     ok.
 1887: 
 1888: %% Returns a directory on a file system that has correct file times.
 1889: 
 1890: get_good_directory(Config) ->
 1891:     proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config).
 1892: 
 1893: 
 1894: consult1(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1895:     RootDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir,Config),
 1896:     Name = filename:join(RootDir,
 1897: 			 atom_to_list(?MODULE)
 1898: 			 ++"_consult.fil"),
 1899:     {ok,Fd1} = ?FILE_MODULE:open(Name,write),
 1900:     %% note that there is no final \n (only a space)
 1901:     io:format(Fd1,
 1902: 	      "{this,[is,1.0],'journey'}.\n\"into\". (sound). ",
 1903: 	      []),
 1904:     ok = ?FILE_MODULE:close(Fd1),
 1905:     {ok,[{this,[is,1.0],journey},"into",sound]} =
 1906: 	?FILE_MODULE:consult(Name),
 1907: 
 1908:     {ok,Fd2} = ?FILE_MODULE:open(Name,write),
 1909:     %% note the missing double quote
 1910:     io:format(
 1911:       Fd2,"{this,[is,1.0],'journey'}.\n \"into. (sound). ",[]),
 1912:     ok = ?FILE_MODULE:close(Fd2),
 1913:     {error, {_, _, _} = Msg} = ?FILE_MODULE:consult(Name),
 1914:     io:format("Errmsg: ~p",[Msg]),
 1915: 
 1916:     {error, enoent} = ?FILE_MODULE:consult(Name ++ ".nonexistent"),
 1917: 
 1918:     [] = flush(),
 1919:     ok.
 1920: 
 1921: path_consult(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1922:     RootDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir,Config),
 1923:     FileName = atom_to_list(?MODULE)++"_path_consult.fil",
 1924:     Name = filename:join(RootDir, FileName),
 1925:     {ok,Fd1} = ?FILE_MODULE:open(Name,write),
 1926:     io:format(Fd1,"{this,is,a,journey,into,sound}.\n",[]),
 1927:     ok = ?FILE_MODULE:close(Fd1),
 1928:     %% File last in path
 1929:     {ok,[{this,is,a,journey,into,sound}],Dir} =
 1930: 	?FILE_MODULE:path_consult(
 1931: 	   [filename:join(RootDir, "dir1"),
 1932: 	    filename:join(RootDir, ".."),
 1933: 	    filename:join(RootDir, "dir2"),
 1934: 	    RootDir], FileName),
 1935:     true = lists:prefix(RootDir,Dir),
 1936: 
 1937:     %% While maybe not an error, it may be worth noting that
 1938:     %% when the full path to a file is given, it's always found
 1939:     %% regardless of the contents of the path
 1940:     {ok,_,_} = ?FILE_MODULE:path_consult(["nosuch1","nosuch2"],Name),
 1941: 
 1942:     [] = flush(),
 1943:     ok.
 1944: 
 1945: 
 1946: eval1(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1947:     RootDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir,Config),
 1948:     Name = filename:join(RootDir,
 1949: 			 atom_to_list(?MODULE)++"_eval.fil"),
 1950:     {ok,Fd1} = ?FILE_MODULE:open(Name,write),
 1951:     %% note that there is no final \n (only a space)
 1952:     io:format(Fd1,"put(evaluated_ok,\ntrue). ",[]),
 1953:     ok = ?FILE_MODULE:close(Fd1),
 1954:     ok = ?FILE_MODULE:eval(Name),
 1955:     true = get(evaluated_ok),
 1956: 
 1957:     {ok,Fd2} = ?FILE_MODULE:open(Name,write),
 1958:     %% note that there is no final \n (only a space)
 1959:     io:format(Fd2,"put(evaluated_ok,\nR). ",[]),
 1960:     ok = ?FILE_MODULE:close(Fd2),
 1961:     ok = ?FILE_MODULE:eval(
 1962: 	    Name,
 1963: 	    erl_eval:add_binding('R', true, erl_eval:new_bindings())),
 1964:     true = get(evaluated_ok),
 1965: 
 1966:     {ok,Fd3} = ?FILE_MODULE:open(Name,write),
 1967:     %% garbled
 1968:     io:format(Fd3,"puGARBLED-GARBLED\ntrue). ",[]),
 1969:     ok = ?FILE_MODULE:close(Fd3),
 1970:     {error, {_, _, _} = Msg} = ?FILE_MODULE:eval(Name),
 1971:     io:format("Errmsg1: ~p",[Msg]),
 1972: 
 1973:     {error, enoent} = ?FILE_MODULE:eval(Name ++ ".nonexistent"),
 1974: 
 1975:     [] = flush(),
 1976:     ok.
 1977: 
 1978: path_eval(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1979:     RootDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir,Config),
 1980:     FileName = atom_to_list(?MODULE)++"_path_eval.fil",
 1981:     Name = filename:join(RootDir, FileName),
 1982:     {ok,Fd1} = ?FILE_MODULE:open(Name,write),
 1983:     io:format(Fd1,"put(evaluated_ok,true).\n",[]),
 1984:     ok = ?FILE_MODULE:close(Fd1),
 1985:     %% File last in path
 1986:     {ok,Dir} =
 1987: 	?FILE_MODULE:path_eval(
 1988: 	   [filename:join(RootDir, "dir1"),
 1989: 	    filename:join(RootDir, ".."),
 1990: 	    filename:join(RootDir, "dir2"),
 1991: 	    RootDir],FileName),
 1992:     true = get(evaluated_ok),
 1993:     true = lists:prefix(RootDir,Dir),
 1994: 
 1995:     %% While maybe not an error, it may be worth noting that
 1996:     %% when the full path to a file is given, it's always found
 1997:     %% regardless of the contents of the path
 1998:     {ok,Fd2} = ?FILE_MODULE:open(Name,write),
 1999:     io:format(Fd2,"put(evaluated_ok,R).\n",[]),
 2000:     ok = ?FILE_MODULE:close(Fd2),
 2001:     {ok,_} = ?FILE_MODULE:path_eval(
 2002: 		["nosuch1","nosuch2"],
 2003: 		Name,
 2004: 		erl_eval:add_binding('R', true, erl_eval:new_bindings())),
 2005: 
 2006:     [] = flush(),
 2007:     ok.
 2008: 
 2009: 
 2010: script1(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 2011:     RootDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir,Config),
 2012:     Name = filename:join(RootDir,
 2013: 			 atom_to_list(?MODULE)++"_script.fil"),
 2014:     {ok,Fd1} = ?FILE_MODULE:open(Name,write),
 2015:     %% note that there is no final \n (only a space)
 2016:     io:format(Fd1,"A = 11,\nB = 6,\nA+B. ",[]),
 2017:     ok = ?FILE_MODULE:close(Fd1),
 2018:     {ok,17} = ?FILE_MODULE:script(Name),
 2019: 
 2020:     {ok,Fd2} = ?FILE_MODULE:open(Name,write),
 2021:     %% note that there is no final \n (only a space)
 2022:     io:format(Fd2,"A = 11,\nA+B. ",[]),
 2023:     ok = ?FILE_MODULE:close(Fd2),
 2024:     {ok,17} = ?FILE_MODULE:script(
 2025: 		 Name,
 2026: 		 erl_eval:add_binding('B', 6, erl_eval:new_bindings())),
 2027: 
 2028:     {ok,Fd3} = ?FILE_MODULE:open(Name,write),
 2029:     io:format(Fd3,"A = 11,\nB = six,\nA+B. ",[]),
 2030:     ok = ?FILE_MODULE:close(Fd3),
 2031:     {error, {_, _, _} = Msg} = ?FILE_MODULE:script(Name),
 2032:     io:format("Errmsg1: ~p",[Msg]),
 2033: 
 2034:     {error, enoent} = ?FILE_MODULE:script(Name ++ ".nonexistent"),
 2035: 
 2036:     [] = flush(),
 2037:     ok.
 2038: 
 2039: path_script(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 2040:     RootDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir,Config),
 2041:     FileName = atom_to_list(?MODULE)++"_path_script.fil",
 2042:     Name = filename:join(RootDir, FileName),
 2043:     {ok,Fd1} = ?FILE_MODULE:open(Name,write),
 2044:     io:format(Fd1,"A = 11,\nB = 6,\nA+B.\n",[]),
 2045:     ok = ?FILE_MODULE:close(Fd1),
 2046:     %% File last in path
 2047:     {ok, 17, Dir} =
 2048: 	?FILE_MODULE:path_script(
 2049: 	   [filename:join(RootDir, "dir1"),
 2050: 	    filename:join(RootDir, ".."),
 2051: 	    filename:join(RootDir, "dir2"),
 2052: 	    RootDir],FileName),
 2053:     true = lists:prefix(RootDir,Dir),
 2054: 
 2055:     %% While maybe not an error, it may be worth noting that
 2056:     %% when the full path to a file is given, it's always found
 2057:     %% regardless of the contents of the path
 2058:     {ok,Fd2} = ?FILE_MODULE:open(Name,write),
 2059:     io:format(Fd2,"A = 11,\nA+B.",[]),
 2060:     ok = ?FILE_MODULE:close(Fd2),
 2061:     {ok, 17, Dir} =
 2062: 	?FILE_MODULE:path_script(
 2063: 	   ["nosuch1","nosuch2"],
 2064: 	   Name,
 2065: 	   erl_eval:add_binding('B', 6, erl_eval:new_bindings())),
 2066: 
 2067:     [] = flush(),
 2068:     ok.
 2069:

 2071: 
 2072: truncate(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 2073:     RootDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir,Config),
 2074:     Name = filename:join(RootDir,
 2075: 			 atom_to_list(?MODULE)
 2076: 			 ++"_truncate.fil"),
 2077: 
 2078:     %% Create a file with some data.
 2079:     MyData = "0123456789abcdefghijklmnopqrstuvxyz",
 2080:     ok = ?FILE_MODULE:write_file(Name, MyData),
 2081: 
 2082:     %% Truncate the file to 10 characters.
 2083:     {ok, Fd} = ?FILE_MODULE:open(Name, read_write),
 2084:     {ok, 10} = ?FILE_MODULE:position(Fd, 10),
 2085:     ok = ?FILE_MODULE:truncate(Fd),
 2086:     ok = ?FILE_MODULE:close(Fd),
 2087: 
 2088:     %% Read back the file and check that it has been truncated.
 2089:     Expected = list_to_binary("0123456789"),
 2090:     {ok, Expected} = ?FILE_MODULE:read_file(Name),
 2091: 
 2092:     %% Open the file read only and verify that it is not possible to
 2093:     %% truncate it, OTP-1960
 2094:     {ok, Fd2} = ?FILE_MODULE:open(Name, read),
 2095:     {ok, 5} = ?FILE_MODULE:position(Fd2, 5),
 2096:     {error, _} = ?FILE_MODULE:truncate(Fd2),
 2097: 
 2098:     [] = flush(),
 2099:     ok.
 2100: 
 2101: 
 2102: %% Tests that ?FILE_MODULE:datasync/1 at least doesn't crash.
 2103: datasync(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 2104:     PrivDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
 2105:     Sync = filename:join(PrivDir,
 2106: 			 atom_to_list(?MODULE)
 2107: 			 ++"_sync.fil"),
 2108: 
 2109:     %% Raw open.
 2110:     {ok, Fd} = ?FILE_MODULE:open(Sync, [write, raw]),
 2111:     ok = ?FILE_MODULE:datasync(Fd),
 2112:     ok = ?FILE_MODULE:close(Fd),
 2113: 
 2114:     %% Ordinary open.
 2115:     {ok, Fd2} = ?FILE_MODULE:open(Sync, [write]),
 2116:     ok = ?FILE_MODULE:datasync(Fd2),
 2117:     ok = ?FILE_MODULE:close(Fd2),
 2118: 
 2119:     [] = flush(),
 2120:     ok.
